keyword: how many calories in a sperm
title: How Many Calories in a Sperm?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a sperm (ejaculation), including key nutrients like protein and carbs, based on average values and quick facts.
h1: How Many Calories in a Sperm?
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3-5 ml volume); composition includes water, fructose, proteins, and minerals; not intended as food.
disclaimer: Values vary widely by individual health, hydration, diet, and volume; this is approximate and for informational purposes only. Consult professionals for health advice.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of sperm contains about 15 kcal, mostly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Higher volume ejaculation (5 ml vs. average 3 ml)
Add to a beverage (mixed with 100 ml water)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one sperm ejaculation?
faqs.a: Approximately 15 kcal for an average 3-5 ml volume.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in sperm besides calories?
faqs.a: About 1 g protein, 2 g carbs (mostly sugars), and trace fats/minerals.

faqs.q: Does sperm have any protein or carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, ~1 g protein and ~2 g carbs per ejaculation, providing the calories.

faqs.q: How does volume affect calories in sperm?
faqs.a: Larger volume (e.g., 5 ml) can increase to ~25 kcal; smaller to ~10 kcal.

faqs.q: Is sperm nutritious as a food source?
faqs.a: It has minimal calories and nutrients; not recommended or significant for diet.
